Stir fruit pieces together by hand. Squeeze juice of lemon over all. Stir in yogurt. Adjust sweetness with more honey if needed. Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

Peel the cantaloupes. Slice into 1-inch thick rings and place on dessert plates. Combine dates, raisins, and nuts. Fill the center of each ring with date-nut mixture. Top with a scoop of yogurt and drizzle honey over the top of each dessert.

ingredients.item: each chopped walnuts, chopped pistachios, slivered almonds and pine nuts

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°.
Mix together first seven ingredients. Cut off 1/4 inch slice from top of each apple. Core, then scoop out pulp. Chop pulp and add to first mixture.

Stuff apple shells with pulp mixture. Place apples close together in a baking pan. Pour the water in the pan, then cover pan tightly with aluminum foil. Bake until apples are tender (about 55 minutes). Uncover. Baste with the syrup in the bottom of the pan. Cool before serving.
Mix together ripe Biblical fruits cut into bite-sized pieces. Add raisins.
Drizzle a little honey over the top, then sprinkle with ground almonds or chopped walnuts.
This may be topped with plain yogurt or cottage cheese.
Preheat the oven to 375°.
In a large bowl toss the apples with lemon juice and honey. Set aside.
Mix flour, date sugar, butter, and cinnamon. Work the butter into it with your fingers until the mixture is finely crumbled.
Add the blackberries to the apples and turn into a buttered nine or ten inch baking dish.
Scatter the chopped walnuts over the top, then add the flour-sugar mixture on top.
Bake until the top is golden and crisp, about 35 minutes. Serve warm with cream.
Preheat the oven to 350°.
Cut the stem ends off the figs. Slice across in half. Set in a shallow baking dish in one layer.
Mix together the remaining ingredients and pour over the figs.
Bake until tender, about 20 minutes. Spoon the syrup over each serving.

ingredients.item: pastry, all purpose, or cake flour

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325°.
Line a 9-inch tube pan with waxed paper that has been cut to fit.
Beat the egg yolks, adding the cold water a little at a time. Beat in half the honey gradually and continue to beat until the mixture peaks for a moment before dropping off a spoon.
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites and when foamy, add salt, anise extract, and the rest of the honey. Continue beating until stiff.
Stir a little of the beaten egg whites into the first mixture. Now add the rest of the whites and sift the flour over the top of the bowl before gently folding into the mixture.
Spoon into the lined tube pan and bake 45-55 minutes. Check with a cake tester, toothpick, or straw. If it comes out clean, it's done.
Invert to cool completely before removing from the pan. May be served topped with fruit or berries, and/or whipped cream.

recipes.title: Apricot Sauce

instructions.text: Soak dried apricots in 2 cups water overnight.
Next day bring to a boil and simmer until soft.
Purée in blender or food processor with 1/4 cup light honey.
Return to heat and simmer until thick.
Combine berries, mint, and remaining lemon juice with apricot sauce.
Heap onto cake.

notes: This sauce is designed to be served over cake

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°.
Sift 1 1/2 cup flour with the salt into a large mixing bowl. Cut in the butter with pastry blender until mixture is the size of small peas.
Sprinkle 4-5 tablespoons water, a little at a time, over the flour while stirring with a fork, until mixture is just moist enough to hold together.
Form into a square and flatten to 1/2 inch. Roll out on floured surface to 12-inch square. Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Toss sliced apples with 1 tablespoon of flour. Place slices down center third of dough.
Drizzle half the honey over apples. Fold up about 1/2 inch at each end. Fold sides over apples, leaving an inch of apples showing down center.
Sprinkle with the rest of the honey and the sliced almonds.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Spread immediately with apricot sauce.

recipes.title: Fudgy Chocolate Layer Cake
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Cakes section

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line bottoms of two 9-inch round cake pans with waxed paper and sides of pans with flour.
Mix flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt; set aside.
In another bowl, beat butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla.
At low speed, alternately add flour mixture and buttermilk into butter mixture until blended. Divide batter equally between prepared pans.
Bake cakes until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Turn out onto racks to cool for 10 minutes. Remove pans and cool completely.
To prepare frosting, beat butter and confectioners' sugar at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add melted chocolate. Add milk and beat until smooth.

Place 1 cake layer on a serving plate with frosting. Top with remaining cake layer. Spread frosting on top and sides of cake. Let cake stand for at least 20 minutes before sprinkling with chocolate shavings.

recipes.title: Boston Cream Pie

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9-inch round cake pan. Line with waxed paper.
Beat together egg yolks and vanilla at medium speed until blended. Beat in half of sugar until very thick and pale.
Using clean, dry beaters, beat together egg whites and salt at medium speed until very soft peaks form. Gradually beat in remaining sugar until stiff, but not dry peaks form.
Fold yolk mixture into egg whites; fold in gently. Do not overmix. Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake cake 25 to 30 minutes. Loosen cake by running knife around edges. Cool completely on rack.

Meanwhile, prepare filling. In a saucepan, mix together sugar and flour. Gradually whisk in milk, then egg yolks, vanilla, and salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat; boil for 1 minute, whisking constantly. Strain through a fine sieve into a bowl. Press plastic wrap on surface. Chill for 30 minutes.
Using a serrated knife, cut cake horizontally in half. Carefully remove waxed paper. Place bottom layer on a serving plate.

To prepare glaze, in a saucepan, bring sugar, corn syrup, and water to a boil over low heat, stirring constantly, until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat. Add chocolate; let stand for 1 minute. Whisk until smooth. Gradually pour glaze over cake, allowing it to drip down sides. Let stand until glaze sets.

notes: Cream pies can spoil easily, so they must be stored in the refrigerator

recipes.title: Toffee-Topped Bars
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Cookies & Candies section

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a 13 x 9-inch baking pan.
In a large mixing bowl, mix together the brown sugar and butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Remove 1 cup of mixture and set aside.
Using a pastry cutter or two knives, cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
To mixture in large bowl, add salt. Using a fork, lightly beat in vanilla. Mix to form a smooth batter.
Continue beating until a smooth batter forms. Spread batter into prepared baking pan.
In a small bowl, combine the reserved crumb mixture and walnuts. Fold in chocolate.
Sprinkle over top of batter in pan. Spread topping evenly over top.
Bake bars for 35 minutes, or until a skewer inserted in center comes out clean.
Transfer pan to a wire rack. Cool bars in pan completely before slicing.
Using a serrated knife, cut into 24 bars. Store in airtight container for up to 5 days.

notes: Measuring ingredients accurately is one of the essential elements for successful baking

recipes.title: Apple-Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, chewy cookies perfect for filling the cookie jar

ingredients.prep_note: finely chopped, peeled (such as Granny Smith)

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a medium bowl, combine oats, all-purpose flour, whole-wheat flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Stir to combine.
Stir in raisins and apples.
In a large bowl, combine egg, honey, oil and milk. Stir in dry ingredients. Mix to form a smooth batter.
Drop batter onto ungreased baking sheets, using a rounded teaspoon of dough for each cookie, leaving 2 inches between. Dip fingers into water. Press dough down to about 1 1/2 inch diameter.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until lightly golden.
Remove sheet from oven. Transfer cookies to cooling rack.

notes: Check cookies while baking to make sure they are not getting overdone on the bottoms, especially if using a dark colored baking sheet

recipes.title: Almond Streusel Cake
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 3, Coffee Cakes section
recipes.description: Transform a plain cake into an irresistible delight with a crumbly almond streusel

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9- or 10-inch tube pan.
To prepare the streusel, in a medium bowl, mix together brown sugar, nuts, and flour. Stir in the butter and zest.

To prepare cake, in a large bowl, using an electric mixer set on medium speed, beat together butter and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in zest and vanilla.
In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
Reduce mixer speed to low. Alternately beat flour mixture and orange juice into egg mixture until blended.
Spoon half of the batter into prepared pan. Sprinkle with half of the streusel. Top with the remaining batter and streusel.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack to cool completely.
To prepare the glaze, in a cup, stir together confectioners' sugar and orange juice until smooth.
Turn the cake out onto a serving plate, placing it right-side up. Drizzle with the glaze.

notes: For a different streusel mixture, substitute chopped walnuts for the almonds

recipes.title: Orange-Glazed Coffee Cake
recipes.description: Light and refreshing, this cake doubles the flavor and fragrance of fresh orange

instructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Let stand until foamy, 5 to 10 minutes.
Stir the warm milk, orange juice, sugar, ricotta cheese, orange zest, salt, and egg into the yeast mixture.

Using heavy-duty electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and set on low speed, beat 2 cups flour into the yeast mixture until a wet dough forms. Beat in remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until a stiff dough forms.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, 5 to 10 minutes, adding more flour as needed to prevent sticking.
Place the dough in a large greased bowl, turning to coat. Cover loosely with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.
Grease a 10-inch springform pan. Punch down the dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 1 to 2 minutes.
Divide the dough into 3 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 20-inch-long rope. Braid the ropes together.
Coil braided dough in prepared pan; tuck ends under. Cover loosely with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until almost doubled, 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 425°F. Brush the dough with glaze.
Bake until the top of the cake is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes. Turn the cake out onto a wire rack to cool slightly.
To prepare icing, in a small bowl, stir together confectioners' sugar and orange juice until smooth. Spread icing over warm cake. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Fresh Berry Crumb Pie
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 2, Cobblers, Custards & Fruit Crisps section
recipes.description: A hazelnut mixture does double duty as a crust and topping in this berry-filled pie

ingredients.prep_note: 1 1/2 sticks, cut into small pieces, for crumb crust/topping
such as blueberries, raspberries, and/or strawberries, for filling

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. To prepare crumb crust/topping, spread nuts in a medium baking pan. Roast the nuts, stirring occasionally, until toasted, about 10 minutes.
Remove nuts from the oven and turn out onto a cloth towel. Rub off and discard the papery skins. Increase the oven temperature to 450°F.
In a food processor fitted with the metal blade, process the nuts until finely ground, about 10 seconds.
In a large bowl, mix together the nuts, flour, and sugar. Using a pastry blender or 2 knives, cut the butter into the flour mixture until coarse crumbs form.
Using fingers, evenly press half of the crumb crust/topping mixture into the bottom and sides of an 8- or 9-inch tart pan.
To prepare the filling, in a medium bowl, mix together the sugar and the cornstarch. Gently fold in the berries. Spoon the berry mixture into the crust, spreading evenly.
Sprinkle the berry mixture evenly with the remaining crumb crust/topping.
Bake until topping is golden and filling is bubbly, 30 minutes. Transfer the pan to a wire rack to cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: Watch nuts very carefully when you are grinding them in the food processor. If you grind them too long, the result will be nut butter.

recipes.title: Peach-Apricot Cobbler
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 2, Cobblers, Custards & Fruit Crisps section
recipes.description: These two fruits combine beautifully to make a homey, warm-from-the-oven dessert

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

In a medium saucepan, mix together sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1/2 cup each of reserved peach and apricot juices. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture boils and thickens, 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Stir in butter, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Add peaches and apricots. Spoon fruit mixture into a 1 1/2-quart casserole.
To prepare topping, mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, butter, and egg. Spoon topping over fruit mixture.
Bake cobbler until topping is lightly golden, 30 minutes. Transfer casserole to a wire rack to cool slightly.
To prepare garnish, beat together cream, honey, and cinnamon at medium speed until soft peaks form.
Serve cobbler warm, topped with spiced whipped cream.

notes: Try this dish with other canned fruit already on your pantry shelf. Use any combination of plums, pears, pineapple, or mandarin oranges.

recipes.title: Crumbly Apple Pie
recipes.description: A buttery brown sugar topping is a fabulous variation on this classic American apple pie

ingredients.prep_note: Granny Smith, Golden Delicious, or Gravenstein, peeled, cored, and very thinly sliced, for filling
cut into small pieces, for topping

instructions.text: Place oven rack in lowest position. Preheat oven to 400°F.
To prepare crust, in a medium bowl, mix together flour and salt. Using a pastry blender or 2 knives, cut shortening into flour mixture until coarse crumbs form.
Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with a fork, until a dough forms. Shape into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and chill for 30 minutes.
On a floured surface, using a floured rolling pin, roll dough into a 12-inch circle. Fit into a 9-inch pie pan. Trim excess dough, leaving a 1-inch overhang; make a decorative edge.
To prepare filling, mix together all ingredients. Spoon into crust.

To prepare topping, in a small bowl, mix together brown sugar, flour, and nutmeg. Using a pastry blender or 2 knives, cut butter into brown sugar mixture until coarse crumbs form. Sprinkle apples evenly with topping.
Bake pie until topping is lightly browned and filling is bubbly, 35 minutes. If pie is overbrowning, cover loosely with aluminum foil. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.

recipes.title: Lemon Meringue Pie
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 11, Pies & Tarts section
recipes.description: Sweet meringue offsets the citrus flavor in this classic lemon-filled pie

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. To prepare filling, in a double boiler, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt. Gradually whisk in water. Cook over simmering water, stirring constantly, until mixture boils. Remove from heat.
To prepare meringue, beat egg whites at medium speed until foamy. Beat in constarch and vanilla at high speed until stiff, but not dry peaks form.
Spoon meringue into a large pastry bag fitted with a star tip. Pipe meringue decoratively over filling to edge of crust. Bake pie until meringue is golden, 12 to 15 minutes.

notes: Make sure the meringue is piped right to the edge of the crust, to prevent the filling from seeping out. When making meringue, it is important not to overbeat the mixture. Adding a pinch of cream of tartar makes the egg whites less prone to overbeating.

recipes.title: Miniature Chocolate Eclairs
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 12, Pastries section
recipes.description: No store-bought eclairs can compare to these bite-size pastries with their rich chocolate center

instructions.text: To prepare filling, cook pudding according to package directions. Chill for 1 hour.
To prepare pastry, in a heavy saucepan, heat butter, water, and salt over medium-high heat until mixture boils and butter melts.
Reduce heat to low. Vigorously stir in flour at once until mixture forms a ball. Remove from heat. Stir in sugar, milk, and vanilla until smooth.
Transfer pastry to a bowl; cool for 5 minutes. Stir in eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease a baking sheet. Drop dough into a 2-inch rectangle, piling dough on top and slightly rounding sides.
Spread each mound into a 4 x 3/4-inch rectangle, piling dough on top and slightly rounding sides.
Bake until golden, 35 minutes. Remove from oven. Reduce oven to 375°F. Bake for 10 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.
To prepare frosting, heat butter. Stir in chocolate, sugar, milk, and vanilla until smooth.
Slice eclairs in half. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of filling onto each. Replace tops and spread with frosting.

notes: A wire rack allows air to circulate below and around the food so it cools without becoming soggy.

recipes.title: Cherry Strudel
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 12, Pastries section
recipes.description: This old-world favorite gets a quick and easy update from ready-made phyllo pastry

ingredients.prep_note: fresh or frozen, thawed, for filling

instructions.text: To prepare filling, in a medium saucepan, mix together granulated sugar, brown sugar, and cornstarch. Stir in cherries, water, and vanilla.
Reduce heat to low, add allspice and cinnamon, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes. Cool completely; set aside.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease a baking sheet.

To prepare pastry, unfold sheets of phyllo so they lie flat. Stack 4 sheets on plastic wrap. Brush top sheet with melted butter. Keep remaining sheets covered with a damp paper towel; brush top sheet with butter.
Spread half of filling along a short side of phyllo stack, starting at the edge with filling. Roll up, jelly-roll style. Fold ends under.
Place on prepared baking sheet, seam-side down. Repeat with remaining phyllo, melted butter, and filling to make second strudel.
Bake until golden, 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer baking sheet to wire rack to cool completely. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar.

recipes.title: Chocolate Cheesecake
recipes.description: Impressive to look at, this dessert will surely please cheesecake and chocolate lovers alike!

ingredients.prep_note: 8 ounces each, at room temperature, for filling

instructions.text: To prepare crust, in a medium bowl, mix together chocolate crumbs and melted butter until well blended. Press into a 9-inch springform pan.
Preheat oven to 300°F.
To prepare filling, in a large bowl, beat together cream cheese, sugar, and eggs at medium speed until smooth and fluffy. Spoon half of cream cheese mixture into crust.
Stir chocolate into remaining cream cheese mixture until well blended. Drizzle over batter in crust to make swirls.
Bake cheesecake for 50 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack. Cool completely.
Transfer cheesecake to a serving plate, cover with plastic wrap, and chill for 2 hours.
Uncover cheesecake; carefully remove the side of pan.
To prepare frosting, in a small bowl, mix together chocolate and sour cream. Spread over cheesecake. Chill briefly until frosting is set.

notes: Cheesecake can be made 2 to 3 days in advance and kept covered with plastic wrap, in the refrigerator. Or, the cake can be frozen for up to 3 weeks. Defrost before serving.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Icing
recipes.description: A nut-sprinkled cream cheese icing is the perfect foil for this moist, not-too-sweet carrot cake

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9-inch round cake pan. Dust with flour; tap out excess.
Mix together flour, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt.

Beat together butter and sugar at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. At low speed, alternately beat flour mixture and milk into butter mixture. Stir in carrots and nuts. Pour batter into prepared pan.

Bake cake until top springs back when lightly touched and a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 40 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack to cool for 10 minutes. Turn cake out onto rack to cool completely.

To prepare icing, beat together butter and cream cheese at medium speed until completely smooth. Beat in vanilla. Beat in confectioners' sugar until well blended. To prepare topping, mix together nuts and brown sugar.
Place cake on a serving plate. Spread icing over top and sides. Sprinkle with nut mixture.

notes: If desired, icing can be omitted. Instead, dust top of cake with confectioners' sugar.

recipes.title: Best-Ever Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 13, Cookies & Candies
recipes.description: These are about as good as cookies get, so make several batches and watch them disappear fast

instructions.text: Mix together flour, baking soda, and cinnamon.
Beat together butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar at medium speed until fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla.
At low speed, beat in flour mixture until blended. Fold in oats and chocolate chips. Cover with plastic wrap; chill for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 2 baking sheets.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Place cookies, 2 inches apart, on prepared baking sheets. Flatten each cookie slightly.
Bake cookies until lightly golden, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer baking sheets to wire racks to cool slightly. Transfer cookies to racks to cool completely.

notes: Make dough ahead of time and freeze it. Later, use defrosted dough to make homemade cookies in minutes.

recipes.title: Chocolate-Pecan Brownies
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - Card 13, Cookies & Candies
recipes.description: Ready in less than an hour, these fudgy treats are delightfully sweet and rich

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F. Grease a 9-inch square baking pan.
In a small bowl, mix together flour and baking soda.
In a small saucepan, combine sugar, butter, and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat; remove immediately from heat.
Stir in 1 cup of chocolate morsels and vanilla extract until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth.
Transfer mixture to a medium bowl. Cool completely.
Stir in eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Gradually stir in flour mixture until smooth.
Stir remaining chocolate morsels and nuts into batter. Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Cut into squares.

notes: For light, moist brownies, cool chocolate mixture completely before combining it with other ingredients; test for doneness 2 to 3 minutes before the suggested baking time.

recipes.title: Low-Carb Pumpkin Cheesecake Bars
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - printed from AllRecipes.com
recipes.description: Low carb cheesecake bars with few ingredients that taste like the inside of a pumpkin pie

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Spray an 8-inch glass baking dish with cooking spray.
Place cream cheese in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment; beat on high speed until smooth.
Add pumpkin puree, eggs, sweetener, pumpkin pie spice, cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Beat well. Pour batter into the prepared dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until center is set, about 40 minutes. Cool to room temperature before serving, or serve cold.

notes: Per serving: 83 calories; protein 3.3g; carbohydrates 5.3g; fat 6.5g; cholesterol 73.5mg

instructions.text: Cream together sugar, margarine and Crisco until very smooth. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until smooth after each. Next add flour with 1/2 teaspoon salt alternating with 1 cup of milk, ending with flour. Fold in flavoring and nuts by hand.
Pour into greased tube pan. Put in cold oven and set temperature at 325 degrees. Bake 1 hour and 45 minutes.
Do not open oven door during baking. Remove from pan immediately.
Blend mix and instant lemon filling together with mixer. Add fruit cocktail, coconut and oil, then beat eggs until foamy and add to cake mixture.
Pour into 13 x 9 inch greased cake pan. Sprinkle 1/2 cup light brown sugar and 1/2 cup chopped walnuts over batter. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
FROSTING: Mix oleo, granulated sugar and evaporated milk. Boil for 2 minutes. Stir in 1 1/2 cups coconut. Pour on top of cake (when cooled).
In large bowl, mix the first six ingredients. Fold and stir thoroughly by hand.
In smaller bowl, combine the other ingredients. Stir until thoroughly mixed.
Make a well in dry ingredients and add wet mixture.
Cream butter and sugar; add egg yolks. Combine flour and salt and sift 3 times.
Combine sour cream and soda. Add flour and sour cream alternately to creamed mixture.
Fold in egg whites and flavorings.
Spoon batter into a 10-inch greased and lightly floured tube or bundt pan.
Bake at 300 degrees for 1 1/2 hours. Yield: one 10 inch cake.

recipes.title: Coco Lopez Cake

ingredients.prep_note: coconut milk used in Pina Coladas

instructions.text: Mix all cake ingredients and beat well, adding the 4 eggs one at a time. Pour into a greased and floured bundt cake pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour. When done, remove from oven and pierce top for icing.
Set cake aside and prepare icing. ICING: Melt butter or margarine and add the orange and lemon juices. Mix together well while heating on stove top.
Dribble icing over cake while the syrup is still hot and the cake is in bundt pan. Let it stay a few minutes.
Turn it over onto a cake plate and remove bundt pan.

Combine mix with 1/2 package of coconut and bake in 13 x 9 inch pan. Allow to cool, then poke holes with handle end of wooden spoon. Pour Coco Lopez over cooled cake. Top with Cool Whip and remaining coconut. Keep refrigerated.

notes: Keep refrigerated

recipes.title: Mamie Eisenhower Chocolate Fudge

instructions.text: After boiling first ingredients 6 minutes, or soft ball forms, 232 degrees, pour boiling syrup over ingredients in bowl, beat until chocolate melts. Pour into buttered pan.
Let stand a few hours before cutting into squares.

notes: Named after First Lady Mamie Eisenhower

recipes.title: John's Maple Candy

instructions.text: In large bowl, mix all ingredients. Roll into little balls the size of walnuts.
Refrigerate one to two hours. (Best if made a day ahead of serving time.)
Also may be rolled in finely shredded coconut or chopped pecans and placed on waxed paper lined cookie sheets until chilled.
Makes about 5 dozen.

notes: Best if made a day ahead of serving

instructions.text: Combine sugar, butter, salt and water. Cook to 284 degrees while stirring.
Add almonds, continue cooking to 350 degrees or until syrup is light brown.
Pour into buttered baking sheet. Spread thin, cool.
Spread chocolate over top. Cool and break.
Combine sugar and soda in deep pan. Mix with wooden spoon. Add cream. Stir carefully to dissolve all crystals before boiling. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat to keep from boiling over. Cook to soft ball stage. Remove from heat. Add butter.
Measure exactly. Too much may keep candy from hardening. Add pecans and beat until thick enough to drop from spoon.
Candy thickens rapidly in two to 3 minutes. Drop on waxed paper. Makes 2 to 2 1/2 dozen, 1 1/2 inch patties.
If necessary, add 1 tablespoon hot water to keep candy at right stage.
Wash apples and remove stems. Insert wooden skewers in stem of apples.
In top of double boiler over hot water, heat butter and water until butter melts. Add caramels and fudgy's, heat until melted.
Dip apples one at a time in caramel mixture then nuts or candy and sit to dry on wax paper.

recipes.title: Double Chocolate Ice Cream

ingredients.prep_note: if you don't have one, then you

instructions.text: First you take the ice cream maker, and turn it on. Then you put the ice in there (the ice cream maker) and put the salt in. After you put the salt in there you let it go for awhile.

And you have to watch it. Then you put the cream in and let it go for awhile. Wait and watch it. Then you put the cookies in (Mom accidentally made this by using too many cookies.) Okay, wait and watch it. Then put it in the freezer for a few days and after those few days are over you can serve it. Now you've got double chocolate ice cream!

notes: Written by a child - charming family recipe

recipes.title: Ice Cream Clowns
recipes.description: Fun ice cream treat decorated to look like clowns

instructions.text: Put 1 scoop of vanilla ice cream in a cone. Put 1 scoop of vanilla ice cream on a plate.
Put cone on top of ice cream on plate. Put 2 Reece's pieces for eyes. Put 1 jellybean for a nose.
Put 2 Spicettes for ears. Put 1 piece of red lace for a smile.

notes: Fun activity for kids

instructions.text: Melt 14 oz white almond bark. Stir until smooth.
Remove from fire and add 1 cup chopped peanuts and 2 cups marshmallows.
Pour into 12 inch pizza pan (you can butter pizza pan).
Top with quartered green maraschino cherries.
Melt 2 ounce white almond bark and drizzle over the top.
Chill in refrigerator.

recipes.title: Honey Sand Balls

instructions.text: In large bowl, beat butter, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, and honey.
Add flour, nuts, vanilla and salt; mix thoroughly.
Shape into 1-inch balls. Place 1 1/2 inch apart on greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 325°F until tinged with brown.
Cool some. Then roll in powdered sugar. Enjoy.

notes: Use real butter, not margarine

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together (except coconut for rolling).
Form into small balls.
Roll in coconut.
Mix butter, sugar, water and vanilla.
Stir in flour, salt, dates and nuts.
Form into small balls.
Bake at 300°F until set.
Roll in additional confectioners' sugar while warm.

recipes.title: Orange Mallow Cream

instructions.text: Combine cream cheese and marshmallow creme, mixing on medium speed, until well blended.
Blend in sour cream and flavor.
Chill.
Serve with luscious orange cake or fresh fruit.

notes: Chill time: 1 hour

recipes.title: Crepes (Fruit)

instructions.text: Mix 10 ounces frozen strawberries (thawed) and 4 ounces Cool Whip.
Place 2 heaping tablespoons of mixture in middle of cooled crepe.
Fold over and sift powdered sugar on top.
Garnish with strawberry.

notes: ANOTHER VERSION: Mix 10 oz package of any berries (thawed, reserving juice) with 2 tbsp sugar and 1 tbsp cornstarch. Cook, stirring over low heat until thick (5 minutes). Spread on 8-10 crepes and roll up. Make syrup with reserved berry juice, 1/4 cup oleo, 1/2 cup water, 1/3 cup sugar, 1 tsp cornstarch. Stir constantly over heat until thick. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream on top.

recipes.title: Wacky Cake with Whipped Cream Icing

instructions.text: Mix all cake ingredients well.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
For icing: Cook milk and flour and let cool.
Beat granulated sugar, Crisco, butter and vanilla on high speed.
Add flour and milk mixture and beat until creamy.
Frost cooled cake.

notes: Called 'Wacky' because it has no eggs or dairy in the cake itself

recipes.title: Hummingbird Cake

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Grease and flour 10 inch tube pan or bundt pan.
In bowl, sift flour, sugar, soda, salt and cinnamon.
Add remaining ingredients and stir until combined.
Pour into prepared pan and bake until done.

recipes.pan_size: 10 inch tube pan or bundt pan
notes: Classic Southern cake

instructions.text: Blend mix and instant lemon filling together with mixer.
Add fruit cocktail, coconut and oil, then beat eggs until foamy and add to cake mixture.
Pour into 13 x 9 inch greased cake pan.
Sprinkle 1/2 cup light brown sugar and 1/2 cup chopped walnuts over batter.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
For frosting: Mix oleo, granulated sugar and evaporated milk. Boil for 2 minutes.
Stir in 1 1/2 cups coconut. Pour on top of cake (when cooled).

recipes.title: Carrot Walnut Cake

instructions.text: In large bowl, mix the first six ingredients.
Fold and stir thoroughly by hand.
In smaller bowl, combine the other ingredients. Stir until thoroughly mixed.
Make a well in dry ingredients and add wet mixture.
Mix until combined and bake.

notes: Black walnuts give this cake a distinctive flavor

instructions.text: CAKE: Stir all dry ingredients (except pecans and carrots) together.
Add eggs and oil. Mix until just blended.
Add carrots and pecans.
Bake at 375 to 400°F for 35 to 40 minutes or until done.
ICING: Mix cream cheese and margarine until smooth, add sugar and vanilla and blend.
Ice when cake is cool.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake (Safflower Oil Version)

ingredients.prep_note: as sweet as you wish, for icing

instructions.text: Mix oil, sugar, and eggs (adding one at a time).
Add dry ingredients and mix.
Fold in grated carrots.
Bake until done.
ICING: Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar, butter and vanilla until smooth.
Ice when cake is cool.

notes: Safflower oil makes this a lighter version

recipes.title: Coco Lopez Cake

ingredients.prep_note: coconut milk used in Pina Coladas

instructions.text: Combine mix with 1/2 package of coconut and bake in 13 x 9 inch pan according to package directions.
Allow to cool, then poke holes with handle end of wooden spoon.
Pour Coco Lopez over cooled cake.
Top with Cool Whip and remaining coconut.
Keep refrigerated.

notes: Must be kept refrigerated

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar, add egg yolks.
Combine flour and salt and sift 3 times.
Combine sour cream and soda.
Add flour and sour cream alternately to creamed mixture.
Fold in egg whites and flavorings.
Spoon batter into a 10-inch greased and lightly floured tube or bundt pan.
Bake at 300°F for 1 1/2 hours.

recipes.title: Watergate Cake

instructions.text: Mix cake mix, oil, eggs, soda, pudding mix, nuts and coconut.
Pour into greased and floured 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes or until done.
Cool completely.
For topping: Mix Cool Whip with pistachio pudding mix.
Spread on cooled cake and sprinkle with coconut.

notes: A 1970s classic - green pistachio cake became wildly popular

recipes.title: Seven Layer Dessert

ingredients.prep_note: sliced & dipped in lemon juice, layer 3

instructions.text: Layer 1: Press crust into 9 x 13 inch pan.
Layer 2: Beat confectioners' sugar, butter and eggs well; pour over crust.
Layer 3: Arrange sliced bananas dipped in lemon juice.
Layer 4: Spread drained crushed pineapple.
Layer 5: Spread Cool Whip.
Layer 6: Sprinkle with chopped pecans.
Layer 7: Top with sliced maraschino cherries.
Chill well before serving.

notes: Must be chilled well before serving

flags: Crust layer ingredients not fully visible

recipes.title: Graham Wafer Candy

instructions.text: Roll butter and sugar for three minutes.
Spread graham crackers in cookie sheet lined with aluminum foil.
Pour butter and sugar mixture over graham crackers.
Top with chopped nuts.
Bake at 350°F for 8 to 10 minutes.

recipes.servings_yield: One box of graham crackers makes 2 batches

recipes.title: Mamie Eisenhower Chocolate Fudge

instructions.text: After boiling first ingredients 6 minutes, or soft ball forms (232°F), pour boiling syrup over ingredients in bowl.
Beat until chocolate melts.
Pour into buttered pan.
Let stand a few hours before cutting into squares.

notes: Named after First Lady Mamie Eisenhower

recipes.title: John's Maple Candy

instructions.text: In large bowl, mix all ingredients.
Roll into little balls the size of walnuts.
Refrigerate one to two hours.

notes: Best if made a day ahead of serving time
Also may be rolled in finely shredded coconut or chopped pecans

instructions.text: In 4 quart bowl mix sugar, milk and butter.
Cook on high 20 to 22 minutes or until soft ball stage (234°F on candy thermometer).
Stir well every 5 minutes during cooking.
Stir in chocolate bits and marshmallow cream until well blended.
Add vanilla and nuts and mix.
Pour into buttered 9 inch square dish for thick pieces or 7 1/2 x 12 inch for thinner pieces.
Cool and cut.
Mix together sugar, evaporated milk, margarine and salt.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Remove mixture from heat and add remaining ingredients.
Pour into buttered pan and chill.
Combine sugar, butter, salt and water.
Cook to 284°F while stirring.
Add almonds, continue cooking to 350°F or until syrup is light brown.
Pour into buttered baking sheet. Spread thin, cool.
Spread chocolate over top.
Sprinkle more buttered nuts on sheet.
Cool and break.

recipes.title: Pralines

instructions.text: Combine sugar and soda in deep pan. Mix with wooden spoon. Add cream.
Stir carefully to dissolve all crystals before boiling.
Bring to boil. Reduce heat to keep from boiling over.
Cook to soft ball stage. Remove from heat.
Add butter. Measure exactly. Too much may keep candy from hardening.
Add pecans and beat until thick enough to drop from spoon. Candy thickens rapidly in two to 3 minutes.
Drop on waxed paper.

notes: If necessary, add 1 tablespoon hot water to keep candy at right stage

instructions.text: Combine molasses, sugar and vinegar.
Cook to soft crack stage.
Stir. Remove from heat, add butter, soda and salt.
Pour into buttered pan.
When cool enough to handle, butter hands, and pull.

recipes.title: Praline Grahams

ingredients.prep_note: *if using margarine, use 2 sticks minus 2 tbsp

instructions.text: Place graham crackers side by side on a 15"x10" greased cookie sheet with 4 raised sides.
Boil butter and sugar together for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat; add vanilla and pecans.
Spread over crackers.
Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven, let settle a few seconds.
Spoon excess onto crackers and remove individually to another cookie sheet to cool.

notes: Best made with butter

instructions.text: Wash apples and remove stems.
Insert wooden skewers in stem of apples.
In top of double boiler over hot water, heat butter and water until butter melts.
Add caramels and fudgies, heat until melted.
Dip apples one at a time in caramel mixture then nuts or candy.
Sit to dry on wax paper.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Candy

instructions.text: Mix together all ingredients.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Refrigerate.

notes: Easy recipe for kids to make

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Nests

instructions.text: Mix first 5 ingredients together in a bowl.
Form into balls and make a "nest" in the center with a spoon or your thumb.
Add Chinese noodles for "twigs" and yogurt-covered almonds for "eggs".

notes: Fun Easter or spring recipe for kids

recipes.title: Rhubarb Cake
recipes.description: A moist cake featuring chopped rhubarb with a cinnamon sugar topping.

instructions.text: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add remaining ingredients. Mix well.
Pour into greased 9x13 pan.
Sprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar mixed with cinnamon (to taste).
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes.
May be served warm with cream or ice cream.
To make sour milk, pour 1 tablespoon vinegar in cup, add milk to make 1 cup. Let stand about 5 minutes.

recipes.title: Baked Stuffed Peaches
recipes.description: Fresh peaches stuffed with macaroon crumbs and baked - serve with cream for those who don't count calories.

instructions.text: Scoop out about 1 teaspoon of the center pulp of each peach half. Mash pulp with sugar, macaroon crumbs and egg yolks.
Place halves close together, cut side up, in greased baking dish (about 8 by 12).
Spoon macaroon mixture into center of each.
Bake in a slow oven (300°F) for 30 minutes, or until peaches are tender. Makes 6 servings.
Serve these stuffed peaches warm. You might offer cream for those who don't count calories.

recipes.title: Fruit Pizza
recipes.description: A dessert pizza with cookie dough crust, cream cheese filling, and fresh fruit topping.

ingredients.prep_note: 8 oz. (the softer kind is the best to use)

instructions.text: Freeze dough for one hour. Line a 14 inch pizza pan with foil.
Slice dough 1/8 inch thick and line pan; overlap slices but don't flatten into pan.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 12 minutes or until browned.
Cool completely. Invert crust onto another pan, remove foil, put on serving plate (I put it back on the same pizza pan).
Combine cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until blended. Spread on crust, arrange fruit.
Put preserves and water in bowl and stir to glaze consistency. Pour over fruit, chill.

notes: Your choice of one of the following for glaze: 1/2 c. peach preserves, 1/2 c. orange marmalade, or 1/2 c. apricot

recipes.title: Friendship Cake
recipes.description: A sweet sentiment cake with ingredient names that spell out friendship - greetings, smiles, hugs, love, sympathy, and hospitality.

instructions.text: Cream greeting and smiles thoroughly.
Add hugs separately. Slowly stir in love.
Sift sympathy and hospitality and fold in carefully.
Bake in warm heart. Serve often.

notes: A sentiment recipe about friendship, not an actual food recipe

recipes.title: Crescent Chocolate Chip Cheese Cake
recipes.description: A layered dessert with crescent roll crust, cream cheese filling, and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Line a 9 x 13 inch pan with 1 package of crescent rolls, press to seal.
Mix cream cheese, sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla until creamy.
Add the chocolate chips less the reserved chips.
Spread on the filling to 1/4 inch from the edges.
Top with second package of crescent rolls.
Pinch the edges together. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes, until golden brown.
Remove, frost immediately while hot.
Melt reserved chips in microwave and drizzle on iced cheese cake.
FROSTING: Mix together. Frost baked cheese cake. Refrigerate when cool. Makes 24 to 36 squares.

recipes.title: Dirt Cake
recipes.description: A fun layered dessert with crushed Oreos, cream cheese, and vanilla pudding - looks like dirt!

instructions.text: Crush in blender, or food processor, 1 large bag of Oreo cookies, set aside.
Cream together 1/2 stick butter or margarine, 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese.
In large bowl, mix 2 large boxes of vanilla instant pudding (add amount of milk according to package of pudding). Add cream cheese mixture and 8 ounces of Cool Whip. Beat together until mixed.
In an 8 inch flower pot, layer the cookie mixture, then the pudding mixture, then the cookie mixture, and so on. End up with the cookie mixture (this looks like dirt).
Add an artificial flower in top.

notes: Fun presentation - serve in a flower pot with an artificial flower

recipes.title: Mini Cheesecakes
recipes.description: Individual cheesecakes baked in cupcake liners with vanilla wafer crusts.

instructions.text: Line muffin tin with foil cupcake liners. Place 1 vanilla wafer in each liner.
Mix cream cheese, vanilla and sugar on medium speed until well blended.
Add eggs and mix well.
Pour over wafers, filling each one almost full.
Bake 25 minutes at 325°F (165°C). Remove from muffin pans when cool.
Chill. Top with fruit, preserves, nuts or chocolate. These are quick and easy and can be cooled quickly in freezer.

notes: Top with fruit, preserves, nuts or chocolate

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Cake
recipes.description: A moist cake featuring peanut butter and brown sugar.

instructions.text: Prepare pans. Cream shortening.
Add slowly and beat in 1 cup brown sugar and peanut butter.
In another bowl, beat together 2 eggs and 1/2 cup brown sugar.
Add this to the first mixture and beat well.
Sift together flour, salt and powder.
Add dry ingredients alternately to first mixture with 1 cup milk with vanilla.
Pour mixture into pans and bake at once until firm in center.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Heavenly Cheese Cake
recipes.description: A rich cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and sour cream topping.

instructions.text: Combine 'crumbs' (graham cracker or cookies), butter and 1/4 cup sugar. Pack into bottom of springform pan.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 10 minutes.
Gently mix cream cheese and eggs. Beat after adding eggs individually.
Slowly add 1 cup sugar and vanilla. Pour into pan.
Bake 60 minutes. Allow to cool for 10 minutes.
Then combine sour cream, 6 tablespoons sugar and 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla. Top with mixture.
Bake at 300°F for 15 minutes longer. Allow to cool slowly at room temperature and then refrigerate.
Remove springform pan sides. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Grandma's Pound Cake
recipes.description: A classic Southern pound cake with buttermilk.

instructions.text: Mix all together and bake at 325°F (165°C) for 60 minutes or until done.

recipes.title: Twinkie Cake
recipes.description: A homemade version of the classic Twinkie using chocolate cake and a creamy filling.

instructions.text: Bake a 9 x 13 inch chocolate cake.
Mix flour and milk. Cook over low heat until thick, remove from heat and cool.
Place shortening, butter, salt and vanilla in mixing bowl and mix.
Add cooled flour and milk mixture and beat at high speed until filling is like whipped cream.
Cut cooled cake in half lengthwise and put on filling.
Place top back on and frost with favorite icing.

recipes.title: Wacky Cake with Whipped Cream Icing
recipes.description: A classic depression-era chocolate cake made without eggs, milk or butter, topped with whipped cream icing.

instructions.text: Bake cake and cool. Mix flour and milk. Cook over low heat until thick, remove from heat and cool.
Place shortening, butter, salt and vanilla in mixing bowl and mix.
Add cooled flour and milk mixture and beat at high speed until filling is like whipped cream.
Cut cooled cake in half lengthwise and put on filling. Place top back on and frost with favorite icing.
ICING: Cook and let cool. 1/2 c. granulated sugar, 1/2 c. Crisco, 1/4 lb. butter, 1 tsp. vanilla. Beat on high speed. Add flour and milk and beat until creamy.

notes: No eggs, milk or butter in the cake - depression-era recipe

recipes.title: Mexican Fruit Cake
recipes.description: A moist, easy fruit cake with crushed pineapple and pecans, topped with cream cheese icing.

instructions.text: Hand mix only. Bake one hour and 10 minutes. Comes out very moist. Makes a big cake. Very good.
ICING: Mix cream cheese, confectioners sugar, oleo, and vanilla until smooth. Ice when cake is cool.

notes: Mix by hand only
Very moist cake

recipes.title: Mountain Cake
recipes.description: A unique cake with farina and bread crumbs that is crumbled when cool and served in a mountain form with whipped cream.

instructions.text: Separate eggs and reserve whites in small bowl. Beat egg yolks, add sugar gradually and beat. Add bread crumbs, nuts, farina, and baking powder one at a time, beating after each addition.
Beat egg white stiff and fold into mixture. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40 minutes.
When cool, crumble into several pieces. Before serving, fold cake into whipped cream.

Pile into mountain form and garnish with cherries. This can also be put in a child's sand pail and sprinkled with crushed Oreo cookies. Garnish with a plastic flower and use sand shovel as serving spoon.

notes: Crumble cake when cool and fold into whipped cream

recipes.title: Cheese Cake (Lemon Jello)
recipes.description: A no-bake cheesecake made with lemon Jello and evaporated milk.

instructions.text: GRAHAM CRACKER CRUST: Combine crushed graham crackers, melted butter, and sugar.
Mix together all crust ingredients. Dissolve Jello mixture and let Jello set slightly.
Soften cheese and combine with sugar and vanilla to add to Jello mixture. Whip 1 can chilled evaporated milk, then fold in Jello and cheese mixture.
Use 3/4 crust recipe for bottom of a 9 x 13 inch pan and then put Jello-cheese and milk mixture in and sprinkle remaining crumbs on top.
Place in refrigerator. Will serve 15. (I put my utensils in the refrigerator awhile so the milk will whip better.)

notes: Chill utensils before whipping milk
No-bake recipe

recipes.title: Black Magic Cake
recipes.description: A rich, dark chocolate cake made with cocoa and black coffee.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together thoroughly. Batter will be thin.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35 to 40 minutes.

notes: Batter will be thin

recipes.title: Cheese Cake (Philadelphia Cream Cheese)
recipes.description: A rich baked cheesecake using Philadelphia cream cheese and sour cream.

instructions.text: CRUST: Prepare graham cracker crust (20 graham crackers, 4 tablespoons sugar and 1/4 pound cream cheese, 2 eggs melted butter) and press into springform pan.
Cream 1 pound of cream cheese. Pour mixture into crust and bake 30 minutes at 350°F (175°C). Cool 20 minutes.
Make top dressing using 1 pint sour cream, 4 tablespoons sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Pour mixture over cooled cake and return to oven for 5 minutes at 500°F (260°C).
After cake cools, refrigerate several hours before serving.

notes: Two-stage baking process

recipes.title: Earthquake Cake
recipes.description: A rich German chocolate cake with pecans, coconut, and cream cheese topping that creates 'earthquake' cracks when baked.

instructions.text: Combine the 1 cup of pecans and 1 cup of coconut and put in the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking pan.
Mix the German chocolate cake as directed on the box. Pour over the nuts and coconut.
Over low heat, melt the margarine and cream cheese. Slowly stir in the entire box of confectioners sugar.
Spoon cream cheese mixture over cake mix. Do not spread, just drop over top.
Bake cake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes.

notes: Do not spread the cream cheese mixture - just drop over top

recipes.title: Toll House Cup Cakes
recipes.description: Chocolate chip cupcakes with a brown sugar and walnut topping.

instructions.text: Cream shortening. Add slowly and beat in 1 cup brown sugar and peanut butter.
Add dry ingredients alternately with milk and vanilla.
Prepare topping by mixing brown sugar, egg, and salt.
Fill cupcake liners and top with topping mixture.
Bake until done.

recipes.title: Fresh Apple Cake
recipes.description: A moist cake with fresh apples, coconut, and chocolate chips - can be made as cupcakes too.

instructions.text: Beat together oil, sugar, eggs and vanilla. Add apples, and set aside.
Sift together flour, salt, baking soda, powder and cinnamon.
Add dry ingredients to apple mixture. Mix well. Add coconut.
Spread into a greased and floured 9 x 13 inch pan (or two 8 x 8 inch pans).
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35 to 40 minutes. Cool in pan.
For individual cakes: Divide mixture by filling 18 to 24 cupcake/muffin tins 3/4 full. Use paper liners. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

notes: Can also be made as cupcakes

recipes.title: Vanilla Butternut Cake
recipes.description: A rich butternut-flavored cake with Crisco and nuts.

instructions.text: Cream together sugar, margarine and Crisco until very smooth.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating until smooth after each.
Next add flour with 1/2 teaspoon salt alternating with 1 cup of milk, ending with flour.
Fold in flavoring and nuts by hand.
Pour into greased tube pan.
Put in cold oven and set temperature at 325°F (165°C). Bake 1 hour and 45 minutes.
Remove from pan immediately.

notes: Start in cold oven
Do not open oven door during baking

recipes.title: Chocolate Pudding Banana Cake
recipes.description: A moist chocolate fudge cake with mashed bananas and chocolate pudding.

ingredients.prep_note: 1/4 c., smashed or crushed before adding to mixture

instructions.text: Empty box of chocolate cake into mixing bowl and follow directions on package for mixing.
Add 1/4 package of pudding mix plus 3 small or 2 large crushed bananas to mixture.
Beat according to directions, 2 to 3 minutes with electric beater or approximately 2 minutes - 300 strokes by hand.
Can also be made with a scratch made chocolate cake, adding all ingredients.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30 to 35 minutes.
Check when cooked with dry top. Frost if you want.
ICING: Optional, but cream cheese icing is delicious.

notes: Can also be made with scratch chocolate cake

recipes.title: Helen's Whole Fruit Cake
recipes.attribution: Mother of LaVona & LaVelda Richmond, FBC Jasmine
recipes.description: A traditional fruit cake with dates, cherries, Brazil nuts, and English walnuts, soaked in brandy.

instructions.text: Sift together sugar, baking powder and flour. Add whole dates, cherries, walnut meats and Brazil nuts.
Add 4 egg yolks, 1 cup sugar, brandy flavoring, orange juice or apricot juice, and vanilla. Mix all together real good.
Fold in 4 stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into tube pan, greased and floured. Bake in 250°F (120°C) oven 1 1/2 hours. Cool.
Soak cheesecloth in brandy. Wrap cake in cheesecloth, then in foil.
Glaze and decorate with candied cherries. Optional: 1 cup coconut, 1 cup candied fruit or 1/2 cup orange peel.

notes: Soak in brandy-soaked cheesecloth and wrap in foil

recipes.title: Buttercream Icing for Cake Decorating
recipes.description: A classic buttercream icing perfect for decorating cakes - stays white with the right ingredients.

ingredients.prep_note: must be clear flavoring for really white frosting
must be clear flavoring for really white frosting

instructions.text: Beat for 5 minutes. Store airtight in the refrigerator. Keeps for months.
If you want chocolate (or brown) frosting, add cocoa to taste.

notes: Use clear flavorings for white frosting
Keeps for months in refrigerator

recipes.title: Chocolate Mousse Torte
recipes.description: An elegant layered chocolate mousse dessert with vanilla wafer crust and whipped cream topping.

instructions.text: CRUST: Combine crushed vanilla wafers with butter. Put in greased cheesecake pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 5 minutes. Melt chocolate, sugar and milk in double boiler. Cool.
Beat egg yolks and vanilla. Add to cooled chocolate mixture.
Beat egg whites and fold in mixture.
Put on wafer crust. Refrigerate.
Add whipped topping mixture before serving.

recipes.title: Low Cholesterol Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: A chocolate cake made without eggs - uses vinegar and baking soda for leavening.

instructions.text: CAKE: Use an 8 x 8 x 2 inch Pyrex pan, ungreased. Sift all dry ingredients.
Add liquids. Mix with a fork to get all lumps out.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until cake is done.
ICING: In a small mixing bowl mix by hand with a spoon: margarine, cocoa and coffee. Add powdered sugar at about a 1/4 of the box at a time. Mix until smooth.

notes: No eggs - uses vinegar and baking soda for leavening

recipes.title: Sour Cream Chocolate Cake & Frosting
recipes.description: A rich chocolate cake made with sour cream and topped with a sour cream chocolate frosting.

instructions.text: CAKE: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 13 x 9 inch oblong pan.
Measure all cake ingredients into large mixing bowl. Mix 1/2 minute on low speed, scraping bowl constantly.
Beat 3 minutes at high speed, scraping bowl occasionally.
Pour into pan and bake 40 to 45 minutes.
FROSTING: Mix butter and chocolate thoroughly. Blend in sugar.
Stir in sour cream and vanilla. Beat until smooth.

recipes.title: Chocolate Pudding Cake
recipes.description: A rich chocolate cake with cream cheese, nuts, and instant pudding layers.

instructions.text: Combine oleo, flour and nuts. Press into 9 x 13 inch pan and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes. Cool.
Fill with the following blend - cream cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip. Top with the pudding mixture - both pudding packages mixed with 2 cups milk. Top with rest of Cool Whip.

recipes.title: Mocha Cake
recipes.description: A no-bake layered dessert with chocolate wafers, coffee, and whipped cream.

instructions.text: Combine chips, coffee, sugar, water, and salt in top of double boiler on very low heat (careful not to scorch), until melted.
Stir and cool. Add egg yolks and vanilla, mix well.
Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold chocolate mixture into whites.
Roll wafers with a rolling pin until fine or put in blender, then sift wafers.
Arrange 1/3 wafer crumbs in 8 x 8 inch square pan; cover with 1/2 of chocolate mixture.
Add another 1/3 of crumbs, then chill 1 hour in freezer. Add other 1/2 of chocolate mixture, then rest of crumbs.
Chill in freezer 2 hours, then move to refrigerator for several hours or overnight.
Serve with dollop of whipped cream on top.

notes: No-bake recipe
Freezer then refrigerator for best results

recipes.title: Upside Down Raisin Carrot Cake
recipes.description: A unique carrot cake with pineapple, raisins, and a cream cheese frosting with orange rind.

instructions.text: Combine oil and sugar. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Sift together flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Add dry ingredients to oil mixture, stirring thoroughly.
Add carrots and pineapple, fold in pecans.
Pour into well-greased tube pan. Bake 1 1/4 hours at 325°F (165°C). Frost when cool.
FROSTING: Beat cream cheese and butter until creamy and fluffy. Add remaining ingredients. Spread evenly onto cake.

recipes.title: Moist Pineapple Cake
recipes.description: A very moist cake made with crushed pineapple and topped with coconut icing.

ingredients.prep_note: 1/2 c., out of a 5 oz. can, for icing

instructions.text: Combine dry ingredients. Add other ingredients and mix.
Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 12 inch cake pan and bake about 45 minutes at 325°F (165°C).
Frost with COCONUT ICING.
Cook icing 2 minutes after margarine melts. Pour over hot Moist Pineapple Cake.

notes: Pour icing over hot cake

recipes.title: Strawberry Angel Food Cake
recipes.description: A light angel food cake with cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, and fresh strawberries.

instructions.text: Mix cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, and almond extract.
Fold in strawberries and Cool Whip.
Layer with angel food cake pieces or spread over cake.

recipes.title: Quick Tomato Spice Cake
recipes.description: An unusual spice cake made with condensed tomato soup - creates a moist, flavorful cake.

instructions.text: Combine first 4 ingredients and set aside. Slice top 1/4 off of cake and set aside.
Carve out center of remaining cake and break into small chunks. Mix chunks of cake, strawberries and Cool Whip into cream cheese mixture.
Fill tunneled cake with mixture and replace lid on cake. Extra mixture can be placed in center hole.

notes: Uses condensed tomato soup
[NEEDS VERIFICATION] Instructions may be corrupted - they reference ingredients not in the list

flags.issue: Instructions appear to be from a different recipe - mention cream cheese, strawberries, Cool Whip not in ingredients. Recipe needs verification from source.

recipes.title: Coconut Cake
recipes.description: A four-layer coconut cake with sour cream and coconut filling.

instructions.text: Bake cake in 2 round layer pans; allow to cool. Cut each layer in half to make 4 layers.
Mix next 3 ingredients and chill. Save out 1 cup of sour cream mixture and add to a 9 ounce carton of Cool Whip.
Spread coconut-sugar-sour cream mixture between cake layers.
Ice cake with Cool Whip mixture.
Can be baked the day before and refrigerated.

notes: Can be made a day ahead

recipes.title: Mystery Cake
recipes.description: A simple cake using coconut and coconut pudding mix.

ingredients.prep_note: or any other kind of cake mix

instructions.text: Mix cake mix, pudding, water, oil, and eggs together.
Bake according to package directions.
ICING: Combine butter and orange juice for icing.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Pound Cake
recipes.description: A rich pound cake made with cream cheese, baked in a bundt pan and frozen.

instructions.text: Cream butter, cheese and sugar. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating thoroughly after each addition.
Add vanilla. Mix in flour a little at a time, blending well after each addition.
Pour batter into a greased and floured bundt pan. Bake at 250°F (120°C) for 2 hours and 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. May be frozen.

notes: May be frozen

recipes.title: Lemon Cream Cheese Filled Cake
recipes.description: A yellow cake with apricot nectar, filled with lemon cream cheese and glazed.

instructions.text: In large bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Beat as directed on cake package.
Grease and flour 12-cup bundt pan. Spoon batter into pan. In small bowl, combine all filling ingredients; beat until smooth.
Spoon filling over batter in pan, being careful not to let it touch sides of pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 50 to 55 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool in pan 1/2 hour.
Turn out on wire rack or serving plate to complete cooling.
GLAZE: Combine all glaze ingredients and stir until smooth. Drizzle over cake.

recipes.title: Ice Cream Cone Cakes
recipes.description: Fun cupcakes baked right in flat-bottomed waffle ice cream cones - perfect for kids' parties.

instructions.text: Prepare any flavor layer cake mix as directed on the package.
Pour a scant 1/4 cup batter into each of the waffle cones. Fill a scant half full, if cones are filled more than this, batter will run over top.
Set in square or oblong pan and bake as directed for cupcakes.
Cool. Frost with any favorite frosting and decorate with candies.
Do not store in an airtight container as the cones will soften.

notes: Do not store in airtight container - cones will soften
Great for kids' parties

recipes.title: The Real McCoy New York Italian Cheesecake
recipes.description: An authentic Italian-style cheesecake made with ricotta cheese, cream cheese, and sour cream.

instructions.text: All ingredients should be at room temperature. Combine ricotta cheese and sour cream in mixing bowl.
Beating slowly, add cream cheese, sugar and butter. Increase speed to medium and add eggs, flour, cornstarch, vanilla and lemon juice.
Beat on highest speed to possible without splattering for 5 minutes.
Pour into 10 inch springform pan. Bake in preheated 350°F (175°C) oven for 1 hour.
Turn off heat and leave in closed oven for 1 more hour. Cool on rack.

notes: All ingredients should be at room temperature
Leave in closed oven 1 hour after baking

recipes.title: Pumpkin Cheesecake
recipes.description: A rich pumpkin cheesecake with graham cracker crust, topped with maple syrup.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease 9 inch spring form pan or spray with non-stick spray.
Combine crust ingredients and line sides and bottom of pan. Beat cream cheese in a large bowl until fluffy.
Gradually add sugar. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually add flour and pumpkin pie mix and blend well. Stir in nuts.
Pour into crust-lined pan. Bake 1 hour and 45 minutes or until center feels firm when touched.
Cool in pan on wire rack. Brush top with maple syrup. Cool completely.

NOTE: To substitute canned pumpkin for pumpkin pie mix, use 1 (1 pound) can pumpkin, increase sugar to 1 1/2 cups, use 5 eggs instead of 3, 1/4 cup flour instead of 2 tablespoons and add 2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice.

notes: Can substitute canned pumpkin - see recipe for adjustments

recipes.title: Banana Split Cake
recipes.description: A spectacular 7-layer no-bake dessert with graham cracker crust, cream cheese, bananas, pineapple, Cool Whip, and maraschino cherries.

ingredients.prep_note: sliced & dipped in lemon juice, Layer 3

instructions.text: LAYER 1: Press graham crackers and melted butter into 9 x 13 inch pan.
LAYER 2: Beat well, pour over crust (beat confectioners' sugar, 2 sticks butter, and 2 eggs).
LAYER 3: 3 to 4 bananas, sliced & dipped in lemon juice.
LAYER 4: 1 (#2) can crushed pineapple, drained.
LAYER 5: 2 (8 oz.) cartons Cool Whip.
LAYER 6: 1 c. chopped pecans.
LAYER 7: 1 c. sliced maraschino cherries.
Chill well.

notes: 7 layers!
Chill well before serving

recipes.title: Old-Fashioned Gingerbread
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book - at least 100 years old
recipes.description: A century-old gingerbread recipe from the Appalachian mountains.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a large loaf pan.
Bake for about an hour.

notes: This recipe is at least a hundred years old.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Cake
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book
recipes.description: A moist pumpkin cake with nuts and raisins.

instructions.text: Mix corn oil, sugar, flour, spice, powder, soda, salt, and pumpkin.
Add eggs beaten well.
Add vanilla, nuts, and raisins that have been mixed with 1/2 cup of extra flour.
Bake in a loaf pan for about an hour at 400-450°F.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Pie
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book
recipes.description: A rustic sweet potato pie with molasses and biscuit dough crust.

instructions.text: Mix together all the ingredients except the dough and bring to a boil.
Cut rolled dough into cubes and drop into boiling mixture.
Put thin slices of dough on top.
Put pan in oven and bake until crust is brown.

recipes.title: Blackberry Cobbler
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book
recipes.description: Simple blackberry cobbler with biscuit crust.

instructions.text: Cook the blackberries until they come to a boil.
Add as much or little sugar as you want, and then add some butter.
Cook until thick.
Roll out the dough, cut as for biscuits, and drop into the blackberries.
Then roll some dough thin, cut into strips, and place on top of the blackberries.
Set the pan in the oven until the crust on top is brown.

recipes.title: Molasses Candy
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book
recipes.description: Old-fashioned pulled molasses candy.

instructions.text: Combine molasses, water, and a few grains of salt.
Boil ingredients (do not stir) to hard ball stage.
Remove from the fire, and let stand until cool enough to hold in well greased hands.
After pulling for some time it will change from brown to a yellowish color.
Cut into pieces.

notes: Do not stir while boiling
Grease hands well before pulling

recipes.title: Molasses Cookies
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book
recipes.description: Simple molasses cookies.

instructions.text: Mix brown sugar, egg, molasses, melted lard or butter, boiling water, and salt.
Add enough flour to knead.
Roll, cut out, and bake in hot oven.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Pie
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: A layered rhubarb pie with biscuits, served cold with milk or cream.

instructions.text: Cut rhubarb stalks just above ground. Slice into half-inch pieces.
Cook with a little water over low heat in uncovered pan, stirring often, until rhubarb is the consistency of applesauce.
Sweeten with honey or syrup.
Layer in large flat-bottomed pan with half inch of rhubarb sauce, layer of split biscuits, layer of rhubarb, etc., finishing with layer of biscuits.
Chill and eat with milk or cream.

notes: Rhubarb leaves are poisonous - use only the stalks

recipes.title: Turk's Delight (Fried Rhubarb Flowers)
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: Battered and fried rhubarb flowers, dipped in sugar.

instructions.text: Gather rhubarb flowers.
Soak one-half hour in salt water.
Drain and dry.
Dip in batter and fry in hot fat.
Drain.
Dip in sugar and eat hot.

recipes.title: Mulberry Candy
recipes.description: Simple candy balls made from mulberries and walnuts.

instructions.text: Crush mulberries and mix with ground walnuts.
Make small balls and roll in sugar.

notes: Red mulberries ripen in June and are best for cooking

recipes.title: Mulberry Pie
recipes.description: A creamy pie made with fresh mulberries.

instructions.text: Cook mulberries and drain.
Mix with two beaten eggs, one cup cream, and 1/2 cup sugar.
Fill a pie shell and bake.

recipes.title: Serviceberry Pie
recipes.description: A pie made from serviceberries (sarviceberries). Jake Waldroop said, 'The berries are just wonderful for pies.'

instructions.text: Heat one pint ripe berries and 2/3 cup sugar.
Pour into a pie shell.
Bake in a hot oven.

notes: Serviceberries can be substituted for blueberries in pie recipes
Also called sarviceberry, juneberry, or sarvis

recipes.title: Serviceberry Flan
recipes.description: A custard flan with serviceberries.

instructions.text: Beat milk, sugar, flour, salt, and vanilla until smooth.
Pour half of the mixture into a buttered baking dish and bake one minute.
Add the berries, then cover with the other half of the mix.
Bake until set.

recipes.title: Dewberry Frosting
recipes.description: A bright frosting made from dewberry juice.

instructions.text: Cook berries and strain.
Use one cup juice to one cup confectioners sugar.
Spread on cake.

recipes.title: Dewberry Pie
recipes.description: A simple dewberry pie with a buttery top.

instructions.text: Mix one cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, and dash of salt.
Fill a pastry shell with dewberries.
Sprinkle the mixture of sugar, flour, and salt over the top.
Dot with butter and bake.

recipes.title: Blackberry Cobbler (Foxfire 3)
recipes.description: Classic mountain blackberry cobbler with biscuit topping.

instructions.text: Cook the blackberries until they come to a boil.
Add the sugar, then some butter, and cook until thick.
Roll out the dough, cut as for biscuits, and drop into the blackberries.
Roll some dough very thin, cut it into strips and place on top of the blackberries.
Bake until the crust on top is brown.

notes: Blackberries were sometimes dried on strips of chestnut bark and stored in sacks

recipes.title: Blackberry Flummery
recipes.description: A chilled blackberry pudding thickened with cornstarch.

instructions.text: Mix berries with water, sugar, salt, and cinnamon, and cook to the boiling point.
Reduce heat and cook slowly until liquid begins to look slightly syrupy.
Make a paste of cornstarch and three tablespoons water.
Stir into berry mixture, cook until slightly thick.
Serve cold.

recipes.title: Blackberry Roll
recipes.description: A rolled pastry filled with blackberries and honey.

instructions.text: Roll dough to 1/3-inch thickness, and brush with melted butter.
Combine 1/2 the berries with cinnamon and honey and spread them over dough.
Roll as a jelly roll. Place in a large, well-greased pan.
Surround with remaining blackberries and sugar.
Bake at 425° for thirty minutes.
Slice and serve from the pan.

recipes.title: Blueberry Cobbler
recipes.description: Mountain blueberry cobbler with sweet biscuit topping.

instructions.text: Cook berries for fifteen minutes over medium heat with one cup sugar.
For dough, use two cups flour and two tablespoons each of sugar and shortening with a pinch of salt and two teaspoons baking powder. Add enough milk to mix.
Drop dough by spoonfuls onto hot berries and bake until golden.

recipes.title: Blueberry Crisp
recipes.description: A simple blueberry crisp with oat topping.

instructions.text: Put berries in a greased baking dish and sprinkle with 1/3 cup sugar.
For topping, cream butter and brown sugar.
Blend in flour and oats with a fork.
Spread over berries and bake.

recipes.title: Blueberry Dessert Rolls
recipes.description: Rolled biscuit dough filled with blueberries, baked upside down.

instructions.text: Cook berries and drain thoroughly.
Make dough from biscuit mix and milk.
Roll out dough, brush with butter, and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.
Cover with blueberries.
Roll up like a jelly roll. Place seam side down in a greased baking dish.
Bake in a hot oven (425°) about thirty minutes.

recipes.title: Gooseberry Pie
recipes.description: A classic gooseberry pie with lattice top.

instructions.text: Mix two cups berries with 3/4 cup sugar and cook until soft and clear.
Pour into a pie shell.
Lay strips of pie dough crosswise on the berries.
Bake at about 450° until the crust is golden.

notes: Wild gooseberries are prickly but very sweet inside

recipes.title: Wild Strawberry Pie
recipes.description: Fresh strawberry pie with syrup topping.

instructions.text: Sift flour, mix with lard, salt, cold water, and vinegar. Mix well and roll out dough.
Put in greased pie pan. Bake fifteen minutes.
Make filling of one cup crushed strawberries, one-half cup sugar, two tablespoons cornstarch, and one cup water. Cook into a syrup.
Fill pie crust with fresh strawberries, pour syrup over top and serve.

recipes.title: Strawberry Mallow
recipes.description: A chilled strawberry and marshmallow dessert.

instructions.text: Mix together strawberries, sugar, salt, marshmallows, and cream.
Chill.
Top with whole berries.

recipes.title: Persimmon Pudding
recipes.description: A rich baked persimmon pudding.

instructions.text: Strain persimmons through a colander.
Stir all ingredients together.
Put in greased pan.
Bake one hour at low heat.

notes: Persimmons are very high in food energy

recipes.title: Persimmon Pie
recipes.description: A spiced persimmon custard pie with meringue topping.

instructions.text: Peel and crush persimmons until smooth.
Add sugar and beat. Add three egg yolks and one egg white.
Add milk, nutmeg, and salt. Beat until smooth.
Pour into nine-inch pie shell and bake until done.
Make meringue by beating whites of remaining eggs until stiff. Add four tablespoons sugar.
Put on top of pie and brown in moderate oven.

recipes.title: Pawpaw Pie
recipes.description: A custard pie made from pawpaws, which taste 'somewheres between a banana and a persimmon.'

instructions.text: Place sugar, milk, egg, salt, and pawpaws in a stew pan and stir together.
Cook until thickened.
Pour in an unbaked pie shell and bake until done.

notes: Pawpaws ripen in late autumn and taste like a cross between banana and persimmon

recipes.title: Wild Plum Cobbler
recipes.description: A layered plum cobbler with strips of biscuit dough.

instructions.text: Cook and pit one quart plums.
Roll biscuit dough thin and cut in strips.
Grease a pan well and add a layer of plums and strips of dough, topping with sugar and dabs of butter.
Repeat until pan is almost full.
Bake in medium oven.

recipes.title: Wild Plum Pudding
recipes.description: A baked plum pudding with cake-like topping.

instructions.text: Put pitted, cooked, sweetened plums two inches deep in bottom of a baking dish.
Beat one cup sugar, four tablespoons butter, and one egg to a cream.
Add one scant cup of milk, two cups all-purpose flour, and two teaspoons baking powder.
Mix well, and pour over plums.
Bake one hour at 350°.

recipes.title: Sugared Nut Meats
recipes.description: Spiced candied nuts with rum flavoring.

instructions.text: Cream oil, sugar, flavoring and spices.
Spread nuts on cookie sheet, heat in moderate oven ten minutes.
Turn hot nuts into the cream mixture and stir.
Separate and spread on a cookie sheet to cool.

notes: Can use walnuts, hickory nuts, or hazelnuts

recipes.title: Nut Brittle Squares
recipes.description: Caramelized sugar poured over nuts for a simple brittle.

instructions.text: Butter the outside bottom of an eight-inch-square pan.
Spread evenly with one cup finely chopped nuts.
Set pan, nut side up, on a tray.
Put one cup sugar in skillet and heat, stirring until golden brown and syrupy.
Pour over nuts at once.
When slightly cooled, remove in one piece to a board and cut into two-inch squares.

notes: Works with walnuts, hickory nuts, or hazelnuts

recipes.title: Chestnut Croquettes
recipes.description: Sweet fried chestnut balls.

instructions.text: Mix one cup mashed, boiled chestnuts with 1/4 teaspoon vanilla, two beaten egg yolks, two tablespoons cream, one teaspoon sugar.
Shape in balls, roll in crumbs.
Fry in deep fat.

notes: American chestnuts are now rare due to blight but still occasionally found

recipes.title: Acorn Indian Pudding
recipes.description: A cornmeal-style pudding made with acorn meal and sorghum.

instructions.text: Put three cups water on to boil.
Mix acorn meal with remaining cup of water, stir until smooth.
Add to boiling water, stir until thickened.
Add sorghum syrup to taste.
Cover and cook fifteen minutes at low heat.

notes: Acorn meal was once a staple of pioneer diet when times were rough

recipes.title: Elderflower Fritters
recipes.description: Battered and fried elderflower clusters.

instructions.text: Dip elderflower clusters in fritter batter.
Fry in fat.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

recipes.title: Black Walnut Pudding
recipes.description: A rich pudding with black walnuts.

instructions.text: Beat egg yolks with sugar until light.
Add milk and flour, cook until thickened.
Add vanilla and walnuts.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into baking dish and bake until set.

recipes.title: Aunt Arie's Egg Custard
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian custard pie from Foxfire 2
recipes.description: A simple egg custard pie baked on a wood stove.

instructions.text: Line a small pie pan with plain biscuit dough rolled thin.
In a separate bowl, mix up one egg (beaten well), one cup of sweet milk, a handful of flour, a teaspoon of nutmeg, half a teacup of sugar.
Mix it all up well, pour into the crust.
Using just a little wood so the fire won't be too hot, bake slowly until it 'sets.'
It will 'blubber up' - or bubble, and then the bubbles will settle. At this point it is ready to eat.

notes: Originally cooked on a wood stove

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Pudding
recipes.description: A baked sweet potato pudding with raisins and coconut.

instructions.text: Mix together all ingredients.
Bake in a casserole dish in a moderate oven for about half-hour, or until firm.
Serve hot or cold.

recipes.title: Mint Frosting
recipes.description: A fresh mint frosting for cakes.

instructions.text: Chop young mint leaves fine.
Mix with powdered sugar, soft butter, and drops of cream.

recipes.title: Fig Pudding
recipes.description: A rice pudding with figs and nuts.

instructions.text: Mix rice, milk, beaten egg, figs, nuts, and spices.
Add vanilla and melted butter.
Pour into greased baking dish and bake.

recipes.title: Honey Figs
recipes.description: Fresh figs drizzled with honey.

instructions.text: Peel figs and cut in half.
Arrange in serving dish.
Pour a thin honey over them.

recipes.title: Mrs. Parker's Bleached Apple Pie
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian bleached apple pie from Foxfire Book 4
recipes.description: A pie made with sulfur-bleached apples that taste like fresh apples even months after preserving.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Place several cups of bleached apple pieces in an uncooked pie crust.
Add butter, sugar, and cinnamon to taste.
Cover with pastry strips or a second crust if preferred.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

notes: Bleached apples are preserved using sulfur smoke in a special box.
Use as little water as possible when cooking bleached apples - water brings back the sulfur taste.
The sulfur taste is not noticeable when apples are eaten dry.

recipes.title: Blanche Harkins' Fried Apple Pies
